content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Certainly! Below is an example implementation of the `extract_julia_code` function in Julia:

```jl
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # Split the markdown document into lines, retaining newlines
    lines = split(md, "\n"; keepempty=true)

    # Initialize an array to hold the extracted code blocks
    codeblocks = Vector{String}()

    # Loop through each line in the markdown document
    for (i, line) in enumerate(lines)
        # If we find a start of a new code block, push the current one to our result
        if startswith(line, "```") && occursin(" julia", line)
            in_codeblock = true
            codeblock_start = i + 1
        end

        # If we are in a code block and reach its end, process it and reset flags
        if in_codeblock
            if endswith(line, "```") && occursin(" julia", line)
                in_codeblock = false
                codeblock_end = i - 1
            end
        end

        # If we are within a code block and not at its end, add the line to our result
        if in_codeblock
            push!(codeblocks, line)
        end
    end

    # Join all the extracted code blocks together with newlines
    joined_code = join(codeblocks)

    return joined_code
end
```

This function works by iterating over each line of the markdown document and detecting the start (`````) and end (`````) of a Julia code block. It then joins all the lines within a code block (after removing the initial ````` and final `````) and concatenates them with newlines.
